q: How do I create a seller account on Shoplite?
a: To create a seller account, visit the Shoplite seller registration page, provide business information including tax ID, link a bank account for payouts, and complete the verification process which takes 2–3 business days.

q: What payment methods can I use on Shoplite?
a: Shoplite supports credit and debit cards, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, and in some regions bank transfers or cash-on-delivery. All transactions are processed securely through PCI-DSS compliant gateways.

q: How long do I have to return a product on Shoplite?
a: Shoplite offers a 30-day return window starting from the delivery date. Buyers must request a return authorization number (RAN) before shipping items back.

q: How are Shoplite reviews verified?
a: Reviews are tied to verified purchases and pass through moderation filters that block offensive or irrelevant content. Verified purchase labels ensure authenticity, and sellers cannot delete or alter customer reviews.

q: What types of delivery options are available?
a: Buyers can choose standard (3–7 days), express (1–3 days), or same-day delivery in select regions. Notifications are provided at each stage of the order.

q: How much commission does Shoplite charge sellers?
a: Shoplite charges 10% commission per sale plus a $0.50 transaction fee. Rates vary by category—luxury goods at 12% and digital goods as low as 5%.

q: What mobile-specific features does Shoplite provide?
a: The mobile app includes barcode scanning, biometric login, offline browsing, push notifications, and one-tap checkout, alongside core shopping features.

q: How does Shoplite protect user data?
a: Shoplite encrypts data in transit and at rest, complies with GDPR and CCPA, and provides user-controlled privacy settings. In the event of a breach, users are informed within 72 hours.

q: What are Shoplite’s return policies and how do I track my order status?
a: Shoplite offers a 30-day return window that requires a return authorization number (RAN). Buyers can track orders in real time via the “My Orders” dashboard with updates from confirmation through delivery.

q: How do sellers manage stock and prevent overselling?
a: Sellers manage inventory via dashboard, CSV, or API with real-time synchronization and low-stock alerts. Checkout verifies stock to prevent overselling, reserving items during the purchase flow.

q: How does Shoplite handle fraudulent transactions?
a: Fraud detection algorithms flag anomalies and may pause transactions for verification. Urgent fraud cases are prioritized and escalated by customer support for rapid resolution.

q: How can developers integrate with Shoplite?
a: Developers use RESTful APIs with OAuth 2.0 to manage listings, orders, inventory, and more. The platform enforces rate limits and provides a sandbox for safe testing.

q: What are the responsibilities of sellers regarding shipping?
a: Sellers must provide tracking numbers within 24 hours of dispatch, define shipping policies in the Seller Dashboard, and ensure on-time delivery or face penalties.

q: What customer support options are available on Shoplite?
a: Support is available 24/7 via live chat, email, phone, and an AI-powered chatbot. The Help Center and the mobile app offer self-service tools and push-notification updates.

q: How does Shoplite ensure fairness in product reviews?
a: Only verified purchasers can review; submissions are moderated to remove offensive or irrelevant content. Reviews carry a “verified purchase” label, and sellers cannot delete or alter them.

q: How are promotional codes validated at checkout?
a: Promotional codes are validated in real time at checkout. Expired or ineligible codes trigger clear error messages, and attempts to stack incompatible codes are automatically blocked.

q: How do Shoplite Plus subscriptions benefit sellers?
a: Shoplite Plus reduces commissions—sometimes to about 7%—in exchange for a monthly subscription and provides benefits like improved search placement and promotional tools.

q: What measures does Shoplite take for data breaches?
a: Shoplite informs affected users within 72 hours, initiates incident response and investigations immediately, and uses support channels to guide users while applying safeguards to prevent recurrence.

q: How do buyers receive updates about their orders?
a: Buyers receive updates by email, SMS, or mobile push notifications and can track progress from confirmation to delivery in the “My Orders” dashboard.

q: How can sellers forecast demand and adjust stock?
a: Sellers use analytics in the inventory dashboard—such as seasonal trends and historical sales—to forecast demand, set low-stock thresholds, and prioritize fast-moving items.
